update.description:
Refletance must be an image.

To include the reflectance:

```
<link>
...
  <visual name="visual">
    ...
      <plugin filename="libReflectancePlugin.so" name="reflectance_plugin">
        <reflectance_map>
          <uri>model://suv/materials/textures/</uri>
          <name>wheels_01.png</name>
        </reflectance_map>
      </plugin>
      ...
   </visual>
...
</link>
```

```
<link>
...
  <visual name="visual">
    ...
      <plugin filename="libReflectancePlugin.so" name="reflectance_plugin">
        <reflectance_map>
          <name>${YOUR_HOME_HERE}/.gazebo/models/suv/materials/textures/wheels_01.png</name>
        </reflectance_map>
      </plugin>
      ...
   </visual>
...
</link>
```

‌

```
<link>
...
  <visual name="visual">
    ...
      <plugin filename="libReflectancePlugin.so" name="reflectance_plugin">
        <reflectance_map>
            <uri>${YOUR_HOME_HERE}/.gazebo/models/suv/materials/textures/</uri>
            <name>wheels_01.png</name>
        </reflectance_map>
      </plugin>
      ...
   </visual>
...
</link>
```

‌

content.raw:
alternatively, we just let the user specify:

```
<reflectance_map>model://my_model/materials/textures/reflectance.png</reflectance_map>
```

and we add the uri using `RenderEngine::AddResourcePath` call
content.html:
alternatively, we just let the user specify:

<reflectance_map>model://my_model/materials/textures/reflectance.png</reflectance_map>

and we add the uri using RenderEngine::AddResourcePath call

content.raw: we could support something like `<uri>` in the plugin param. Once we have the URI, we can [add the path to the render engine](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c1537db2c8550db2566a634fcee382a7ab6d7fbe/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc#lines-474). It’s similar to how we let users specify <material> <uri> for visuals
content.html: we could support something like <uri> in the plugin param. Once we have the URI, we can add the path to the render engine. It’s similar to how we let users specify <material> <uri> for visuals

content.raw:
Thanks, the absolute paths work for me!

@{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5}, is that the recommended way of setting custom maps? Should we also support something with environment variables? I tried `OGRE_RESOURCE_PATH` and that doesn't seem to work. The problem with absolute paths is that it's not portable.
content.html:
Thanks, the absolute paths work for me!

@Ian Chen, is that the recommended way of setting custom maps? Should we also support something with environment variables? I tried OGRE_RESOURCE_PATH and that doesn't seem to work. The problem with absolute paths is that it's not portable.

content.raw: I have added absolute paths as a possible option [https://bitbucket.org/ahcorde/gazebo/commits/929db93165d5ea8b06dd9a259d25806ff88c6f56?at=gazebo9](https://bitbucket.org/ahcorde/gazebo/commits/929db93165d5ea8b06dd9a259d25806ff88c6f56?at=gazebo9)
content.html: I have added absolute paths as a possible option https://bitbucket.org/ahcorde/gazebo/commits/929db93165d5ea8b06dd9a259d25806ff88c6f56?at=gazebo9

content.raw:
Thank you for adding docs. You mentioned that "Resources are found in the texture folder". But for a downstream user, it's probably not clear what folder that is. Moreover, I think they shouldn't be limited to the textures installed with Gazebo, right? Otherwise I think this plugin wouldn't be very useful.

I tried passing a full path to a texture (with and without `file://`), and also tried setting `OGRE_RESOURCE_PATH` without any luck and without any error messages. There must be a way for a user to use a custom reflectance map, right?
content.html:
Thank you for adding docs. You mentioned that "Resources are found in the texture folder". But for a downstream user, it's probably not clear what folder that is. Moreover, I think they shouldn't be limited to the textures installed with Gazebo, right? Otherwise I think this plugin wouldn't be very useful.

I tried passing a full path to a texture (with and without file://), and also tried setting OGRE_RESOURCE_PATH without any luck and without any error messages. There must be a way for a user to use a custom reflectance map, right?

content.raw: This comment seems out of place?

content.raw: Do `ReflectanceMaterialSwitcher` and `ReflectanceRenderTargetListener` need to be in the header, or can they be moved to the `cc` file? It doesn't look like downstream code will need to use them directly, and if they're not in the header we have more flexibility to change them in the future.
content.html: Do ReflectanceMaterialSwitcher and ReflectanceRenderTargetListener need to be in the header, or can they be moved to the cc file? It doesn't look like downstream code will need to use them directly, and if they're not in the header we have more flexibility to change them in the future.

content.raw:
`override`?

(also for other Ogre functions in this file)
content.html:
override?

(also for other Ogre functions in this file)
